resources

Class LoadableResourceMetaData

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.LoadableResourceMetaData

  • public class LoadableResourceMetaData
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores meta data for loadable resources like it's path or it's size.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int dataSize
      The stored resource's size in bytes.
      protected ResourceManager.ResourceState dataStorePolicy
      The resource's data store policy.
      private long lastActive
      Time in miliseconds when the resource last time used.
      private java.lang.String path
      Resource's path.
      private long ramTimeLimit
      If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM.
      private ResourceManager.ResourceState state
      Determines where the resource is currently stored.
      private long vramTimeLimit
      If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM.

    • Field Detail

      • dataStorePolicy

        protected ResourceManager.ResourceState dataStorePolicy
        The resource's data store policy. VRAM means that the resource's data will be stored in VRAM. RAM means that the resource's data may be removed from VRAM to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the resource's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM if it's rarely used.

      • state

        private ResourceManager.ResourceState state
        Determines where the resource is currently stored.

      • path

        private java.lang.String path
        Resource's path.

      • lastActive

        private long lastActive
        Time in miliseconds when the resource last time used.

      • vramTimeLimit

        private long vramTimeLimit
        If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM.

      • ramTimeLimit

        private long ramTimeLimit
        If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM.

      • dataSize

        private int dataSize
        The stored resource's size in bytes.

      • getDataSize

        public int getDataSize()
        Retursn the stored resource's size.
        Returns:
        resource's size (in bytes)

      • setDataSize

        public void setDataSize(int size)
        Sets the resource's data size to the given value.
        Parameters:
        size - data size (in bytes)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - size can't be negative

      • getState

        @Nullable
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getState()
        Returns the resource's state. It determines where the resource is currently stored.
        Returns:
        the resource's state

      • setState

        public void setState(@NotNull
                     ResourceManager.ResourceState rs)
        Sets the resource's state to the given value.
        Parameters:
        rs - state
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - parameter can't be null

      • getDataStorePolicy

        @Nullable
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getDataStorePolicy()
        Returns the resource's data store policy. VRAM means that the resource's data will be stored in VRAM. RAM means that the resource's data may be removed from VRAM to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the resource's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM if it's rarely used.
        Returns:
        the resource's data store policy

      • setDataStorePolicy

        public void setDataStorePolicy(@NotNull
                               ResourceManager.ResourceState rs)
        Sets the resource's data store policy to the given value.
        Parameters:
        rs - data store policy
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - parameter can't be null

      • getVramTimeLimit

        public long getVramTimeLimit()
        Returns the VRAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM.
        Returns:
        VRAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setVramTimeLimit

        public void setVramTimeLimit(long vramTimeLimit)
        Sets the VRAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM.
        Parameters:
        vramTimeLimit - VRAM time limit (in miliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - VRAM time limit have to be higher than 0 and lower than RAM time limit

      • getRamTimeLimit

        public long getRamTimeLimit()
        Returns the RAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM.
        Returns:
        RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setRamTimeLimit

        public void setRamTimeLimit(long ramTimeLimit)
        Sets the RAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM.
        Parameters:
        ramTimeLimit - RAM time limit (in miliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - RAM time limit have to be higher than VRAM time limit

public java.lang.String getPath()
